importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The research voyage in the Gascoyne Marine Park began in late 2022, marking the start of a significant deep-sea exploration that led to the discovery of multiple new species.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from 2022 to 2025 encompasses the discovery and ongoing study of deep-sea species, highlighting the long-term scientific process of identifying and naming new life forms.

keyTakeAways: A semi-transparent crab about the size of an almond and a tiny glowing lantern shark have been discovered in the deep sea off Western Australia.
The new species include the West Australian Lantern Shark (up to 40cm, found over 600m below sea level) and a porcelain crab about 1.5cm long found at 122m depth.
Porcelain crabs use hairs to filter plankton, unlike typical crabs that use claws to grasp food.
Lantern sharks are bioluminescent, with light produced by photophores on their belly and flanks.
Australia is a global biodiversity hotspot with over a million species, many of which remain unexplored due to the vastness of its uncharted marine environments.
Approximately 20 new species have been identified so far from the 2022 voyage, with scientists estimating 600 more yet to be described and named.
The discovery process can take years due to the need for extensive scientific analysis to confirm species uniqueness.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Australian scientists from CSIRO, during a 2022 deep-sea expedition in the Gascoyne Marine Park near Western Australia, discovered two new species: a semi-transparent porcelain crab about 1.5cm long, using hairs to filter food, and a glowing West Australian Lantern Shark up to 40cm long, found over 600m below sea level. These discoveries, along with others like the Carnavon Flapjack Octopus, highlight the rich but unexplored biodiversity of Australia's deep oceans, where over 600 new species are estimated to remain undiscovered. The findings underscore the importance of marine exploration and the unique adaptations of deep-sea life, such as bioluminescence and specialized feeding mechanisms.
title: Australia: Almond-sized crab and tiny lantern shark discovered in deep seas
